name: Fire Control
description: Mastery of fire for warmth, cooking, and protection.

name: Stone Tool Making
description: Crafting basic tools from stone (e.g., hand axes, scrapers).

name: Bone Tool Making
description: Crafting tools and needles from animal bones.

name: Basic Woodworking
description: Shaping wood for simple tools, shelters, and fire fuel.

name: Basic Shelter
description: Construction of rudimentary shelters for protection from elements.

name: Basic Tools
description: Rudimentary tools made from stone, wood, and bone, combining various techniques.

name: Trapping
description: Using snares and pits to capture animals.

name: Fishing Nets & Hooks
description: Crafting nets and hooks for efficient fishing.

name: Hunting & Gathering
description: Societies primarily sustained by foraging and hunting.

name: Plant Domestication
description: Early cultivation of wild plants for food.

name: Animal Domestication
description: Taming and breeding animals for food, labor, or companionship.

name: Agriculture
description: The cultivation of crops, leading to settled societies.

name: Animal Husbandry
description: Systematic breeding and raising of livestock.

name: Pottery
description: Crafting vessels from clay for storage and cooking.

name: Herbalism
description: Use of plants for medicinal purposes.

name: Early Boats
description: Construction of simple rafts and dugout canoes.

name: Sailing
description: Use of wind-powered vessels for navigation across water.

name: Early Navigation
description: Basic coastal navigation and celestial observation for seafaring.

name: Wheel
description: Circular component enabling carts and early vehicles.

name: Archery
description: Use of bows and arrows for hunting and warfare.

name: Masonry
description: Stone shaping techniques for building durable structures.

name: Early Fortifications
description: Construction of basic defensive structures like palisades and earthworks.

name: Irrigation
description: Controlled water management for agriculture.

name: Horseback Riding
description: Using horses for travel and warfare.

name: Mining
description: Extraction of valuable minerals and other geological materials from the Earth.

name: Glassmaking
description: Creating glass for containers and ornaments from sand and ash.

name: Textiles & Weaving
description: Processing plant and animal fibers into threads and cloth.

name: Record Keeping
description: Early systems of tallying and recording information (e.g. knots, tokens).

name: Calendars
description: Systems for tracking time based on celestial cycles, vital for agriculture.

name: Writing
description: Development of systems to record language and information.

name: Bronze Working
description: Alloying copper and tin to create bronze for tools and weapons.

name: Iron Working
description: Smelting iron ore to produce iron and steel, stronger than bronze.

name: Philosophy
description: Systematic study of general and fundamental questions.

name: Mathematics
description: The study of numbers, quantity, space, structure, and change.

name: Geometry
description: Branch of mathematics concerned with properties of space such as distance, shape, size, and relative position of figures.

name: Basic Algebra
description: Early methods for solving equations and understanding symbolic representation.

name: Concrete
description: A composite material made of aggregate bonded with cement, for durable construction.

name: Arches and Domes
description: Architectural innovations allowing for larger and more stable structures.

name: Construction
description: Advanced building techniques for temples, roads, and aqueducts.

name: Roads
description: Engineered pathways for efficient land travel and trade.

name: Surveying
description: Techniques for determining terrestrial or three-dimensional positions of points and the distances and angles between them.

name: Aqueducts
description: Structures to convey water over long distances.

name: Hydraulics
description: The study and application of fluid mechanics, particularly water.

name: Currency
description: Standardized medium of exchange.

name: Navigation
description: Techniques for determining position and course during travel, including celestial navigation.

name: Lighthouses
description: Towers with light beacons to guide ships at sea.

name: Plumbing
description: Water supply and waste removal systems for buildings.

name: Public Health Systems
description: Development of sanitation, sewers, and public baths to improve urban hygiene.

name: Siege Engineering
description: Design of equipment for attacking fortified positions (catapults, siege towers).

name: Organized Military Formations
description: Development of disciplined troop formations and tactics (e.g., phalanx, legion).

name: Logistics & Supply Lines
description: Systems for supplying armies and large populations over distances.

name: Theater
description: Development of dramatic performances and stagecraft.

name: Libraries
description: Institutions for collecting, preserving, and accessing written knowledge.

name: Early Optics
description: Basic understanding of light, reflection, and refraction; simple lenses.

name: Alchemy
description: Early form of investigation of nature and philosophical and spiritual discipline, precursor to chemistry.

name: Basic Chemistry
description: Systematic experimentation with substances, distillation, and refinement processes.

name: Feudalism
description: Social, economic, and political system based on land tenure and loyalty.

name: Engineering
description: Practical application of scientific and mathematical principles for design and construction (e.g., castles, cathedrals).

name: Universities
description: Institutions of higher learning.

name: Scholasticism
description: Method of critical thought which dominated teaching in medieval universities, emphasizing dialectical reasoning.

name: Gunpowder
description: Explosive mixture used in early firearms and cannons.

name: Early Medicine
description: Basic understanding of anatomy, herbal remedies, and surgical practices.

name: Horse Collar
description: Harness allowing horses to pull heavy loads efficiently, improving agriculture.

name: Stirrups
description: Device for securing a horseman's feet, enabling more stable riding and mounted combat.

name: Heavy Cavalry
description: Mounted warriors equipped with armor and lances, dominant in medieval warfare.

name: Plate Armor
description: Full suits of articulated steel plate offering superior protection.

name: Advanced Metallurgy (Medieval)
description: Improved techniques for smelting, forging, and heat-treating metals.

name: Crossbow
description: Mechanical bow that shoots bolts with great force.

name: Windmills
description: Harnessing wind power for grinding grain and pumping water.

name: Watermills
description: Using water power for grinding, sawing, and other industrial processes.

name: Compass
description: Magnetic device for determining direction, revolutionizing navigation.

name: Paper Making
description: Production of paper from pulp for writing and printing.

name: Cannons
description: Artillery pieces utilizing gunpowder to fire projectiles.

name: Crop Rotation (Three-Field System)
description: Agricultural practice of rotating crops in three fields to improve soil fertility and yields.

name: Guilds
description: Associations of artisans or merchants who oversee the practice of their craft/trade in a particular area.

name: Banking (Early Forms)
description: Early financial practices like money lending, letters of credit by merchant families and religious orders.

name: Printing Press
description: Mechanical device for applying pressure to an inked surface, transferring ink to paper.

name: Scientific Method
description: Systematic observation, measurement, experiment, and the formulation, testing, and modification of hypotheses.

name: Humanism
description: Intellectual movement emphasizing human potential and achievements, drawing on classical antiquity.

name: Banking
description: Sophisticated financial institutions and practices, including lending, currency exchange, and investment.

name: Double-Entry Bookkeeping
description: Accounting system that records each transaction in at least two different accounts.

name: Astronomy
description: Study of celestial objects and phenomena, revolutionized by new tools and methods.

name: Cartography
description: Creation of detailed maps for exploration and navigation.

name: Clockwork Mechanisms
description: Precision gears enabling mechanical clocks and devices.

name: Telescope
description: Optical instrument that magnifies distant objects in the sky.

name: Microscope
description: Instrument for viewing very small objects.

name: Human Anatomy & Physiology
description: Detailed study of the structure and function of the human body through dissection and observation.

name: Perspective in Art
description: Techniques for creating an illusion of three-dimensional depth on a two-dimensional surface.

name: Early Firearms
description: Development of personal gunpowder weapons like arquebuses and muskets.

name: Musketry Formations
description: Military tactics developed for ranks of soldiers armed with muskets.

name: Steam Engine
description: Heat engine that performs mechanical work using steam as its working fluid.

name: Advanced Chemistry
description: Deep understanding of molecular interactions, elements, and material science.

name: Electricity
description: Understanding and harnessing electrical phenomena.

name: Dynamo
description: Early electrical generator capable of delivering power for industry.

name: Telegraph
description: Long-distance transmission of text messages using electrical signals.

name: Mass Production
description: Manufacture of large quantities of standardized products, often using interchangeable parts.

name: Assembly Line
description: Manufacturing process where parts are added sequentially to create a finished product.

name: Railroads
description: Mode of transport using trains running on tracks, powered by steam.

name: Steel Production
description: Process of producing strong steel in large quantities (e.g., Bessemer process).

name: Bessemer Process
description: First inexpensive industrial process for the mass production of steel from molten pig iron.

name: Factory System
description: Organization of labor and machinery in centralized factories.

name: Photography
description: Capturing images using light-sensitive materials.

name: Oil Drilling
description: Extraction of petroleum from underground reservoirs.

name: Geology
description: Scientific study of the Earth, its materials, structure, processes, and history.

name: Chemical Fertilizers
description: Synthesized nutrients to enhance crop yields.

name: Refrigeration
description: Artificial cooling for food preservation and industry.

name: Medicine (Clinical)
description: Systematic diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease based on scientific principles.

name: Germ Theory of Disease
description: Understanding that many diseases are caused by microorganisms.

name: Anesthetics
description: Substances that induce insensitivity to pain, revolutionizing surgery.

name: Vaccination
description: Using weakened or killed pathogens to stimulate immunity and prevent diseases.

name: Public Education Systems
description: State-sponsored formal schooling for large segments of the population.

name: Telephone
description: Device for transmitting speech over electrical wires.

name: Internal Combustion Engine
description: Engine that generates motive power by burning fuel within the engine itself.

name: Vulcanized Rubber
description: Chemical process for converting natural rubber into more durable materials.

name: Sewing Machine
description: Machine used to stitch fabric and other materials together with thread.

name: Quantum Physics
description: Fundamental theory in physics describing nature at the smallest scales of energy levels of atoms and subatomic particles.

name: Electronics
description: Science of controlling electrical energy in which electrons have a fundamental role, including vacuum tubes and semiconductors.

name: Semiconductors
description: Materials with electrical conductivity between a conductor and an insulator, basis of modern electronics.

name: Automobile
description: Self-propelled road vehicle powered by an internal combustion engine.

name: Flight (Powered)
description: Achieving sustained travel through the air with heavier-than-air craft.

name: Telecommunications
description: Transmission of information over significant distances by electronic means (radio, television, telephone networks).

name: Radio
description: Wireless transmission of signals using electromagnetic waves.

name: Radio Broadcasting
description: Mass distribution of audio content via radio waves.

name: Television
description: System for transmitting visual images and sound that are reproduced on screens.

name: Plastics
description: Synthetic or semi-synthetic materials that use polymers as a main ingredient, enabling new manufacturing possibilities.

name: Antibiotics
description: Drugs that kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria, revolutionizing medicine.

name: Nuclear Fission
description: Splitting of atomic nuclei, releasing vast amounts of energy.

name: Nuclear Power
description: Using controlled nuclear fission to produce electricity.

name: Nuclear Weapons
description: Extremely destructive weapons powered by nuclear fission or fusion.

name: Jet Engine
description: Airbreathing engine that produces thrust from a fast-moving jet of hot gas.

name: Computers (Mainframe/Early)
description: Electronic devices for storing and processing data using vacuum tubes or transistors.

name: Integrated Circuits (Microchips)
description: Miniaturized electronic circuits (chips) that drastically reduce size and cost of electronics.

name: Personal Computers
description: Affordable computers for individual use, powered by microprocessors.

name: DNA Structure
description: Discovery of the double helix structure of deoxyribonucleic acid, the basis of heredity.

name: Lasers
description: Devices that emit light through a process of optical amplification based on the stimulated emission of electromagnetic radiation.

name: Fiber Optics
description: Technology that uses glass (or plastic) threads (fibers) to transmit data as light pulses.

name: Rocketry
description: Propulsion technology for reaching high altitudes and space using reaction engines.

name: Space Flight
description: Travel beyond Earth's atmosphere.

name: Solar Power
description: Harnessing energy from sunlight to produce electricity using photovoltaic cells.

name: Satellite Technology
description: Use of artificial satellites for communication, observation, and navigation.

name: Internet
description: Global system of interconnected computer networks.

name: Mobile Phones
description: Portable communication devices using cellular networks.

name: Robotics
description: Design and use of autonomous or remote-controlled machines for industrial and other applications.

name: Artificial Intelligence (Early)
description: Machine systems capable of tasks requiring basic human-like intelligence (e.g. expert systems, early machine learning).

name: Atomic Clocks
description: Extremely precise timekeeping devices based on atomic resonance.

name: Global Positioning System (GPS)
description: Satellite-based navigation providing location data worldwide.

name: Wind Power (Modern)
description: Generating electricity from large-scale wind turbines.

name: Skyscrapers
description: Very tall buildings made possible by steel frames and elevators.

name: Virtual Reality
description: Immersive computer-simulated environments.

name: Genetic Sequencing
description: Determining the precise order of nucleotides within a DNA molecule.

name: Gene Therapy (Early)
description: Experimental techniques to treat or cure diseases by modifying an individual's genes.

name: Neuroscience
description: Scientific study of the nervous system, including the brain.

name: Psychology
description: The scientific study of mind and behavior.

name: Nuclear Fusion Research
description: Theoretical and experimental efforts to harness nuclear fusion energy.

name: Nanotechnology
description: Engineering of functional systems at the molecular scale.

name: Advanced Materials Science
description: Design and discovery of new materials with novel properties, often at the nanoscale (e.g. metamaterials, advanced composites).

name: Genetic Engineering
description: Direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology.

name: CRISPR Gene Editing
description: Highly precise and versatile technology for editing genomes.

name: Personalized Medicine
description: Tailoring medical treatment to the individual characteristics of each patient, often based on genetic makeup.

name: Advanced AI (Deep Learning)
description: AI based on neural networks with multiple layers, capable of complex pattern recognition and learning.

name: Quantum Computing
description: Exploitation of quantum phenomena like superposition and entanglement to perform computation.

name: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)
description: AI with human-like cognitive abilities across a wide range of tasks.

name: Closed-Loop Life Support
description: Self-sustaining systems for providing air, water, and food for humans in isolated environments like spacecraft.

name: Space Colonization
description: Permanent human settlement off Earth.

name: Fusion Power
description: Harnessing energy from nuclear fusion reactions, potentially providing clean and abundant energy.

name: Superconductors (High Temperature)
description: Materials that exhibit zero electrical resistance at relatively high temperatures, enabling powerful magnets and efficient power transmission.

name: Quantum Communications
description: Secure communication methods based on quantum entanglement and other quantum phenomena.

name: Terraforming
description: Hypothetical process of modifying a planet's atmosphere, temperature, surface topography and ecology to be similar to Earth's environment.

name: Brain Mapping
description: Comprehensive mapping of neural connections in the brain.

name: Brain-Computer Interface (BCI)
description: Direct communication pathway between an enhanced or wired brain and an external device.

name: Mind Uploading (Whole Brain Emulation)
description: Hypothetical process of transferring human consciousness to a digital medium.

name: Digital Immortality
description: Hypothetical concept of storing a person's personality or consciousness in a digital format to achieve a form of immortality.

name: Interstellar Travel
description: Travel between star systems, requiring advanced propulsion and life support.

name: Exoplanet Detection & Analysis
description: Advanced techniques for finding and characterizing planets outside our solar system.

name: Cryonics
description: Preservation of humans at low temperatures with the hope of future revival and treatment.

name: Synthetic Biology
description: Designing and constructing new biological parts, devices, and systems, or re-designing existing, natural biological systems for useful purposes.

name: Utility Fog / Programmable Matter
description: Hypothetical collection of tiny robots (nanobots) that can replicate a physical structure or change shape.

name: Advanced Swarm Robotics
description: Coordination of large numbers of relatively simple robots to perform complex tasks, inspired by social insects.

name: Self-Replicating Systems
description: Machines or organisms (synthetic or otherwise) capable of autonomously reproducing themselves.
